item.title: On Writing Novels
item.description: On Writing Novels I have always taken writing for children and writing for adults equally seriously, but my relationship with the adult novels is different, more willed, less “given”. There are of course repetitive themes. My children say that my definitive novel will be about a chimpanzee trying to support a great country house by writing best-sellers. I was brought up as one of the impoverished gentry, but despite a patrician accent and manner have never felt confident that I belonged in my supposed class; and I spent formative parts of my adolescence in a big Georgian house where my two old cousins were struggling on inadequate funds to keep things going in order to be able to hand it on to the heir to whom it was entailed.
